o: Protection of wild animals and their habitats

q: Conservation aims to protect ______ and ecosystems.
Conservation biology is a crisis discipline.

o: Variety of life at all levels

q: Biodiversity includes genetic, species, and ______ diversity.
Higher biodiversity generally means healthier ecosystems.

o: Group of organisms that can interbreed

q: Species are the basic unit of ______.
Scientists estimate millions of species remain undiscovered.
Extinction is ______ and cannot be reversed.
We are currently in the sixth mass extinction.

o: Species at high risk of extinction

q: Match IUCN category with risk level:
Rearrange IUCN Red List categories by threat level:
The IUCN Red List assesses species extinction risk.

o: Destruction of natural environments where species live

q: Habitat loss is the leading cause of species ______.
Match habitat loss driver with activity:
Over 80% of terrestrial biodiversity is in forests.

o: Breaking continuous habitat into smaller pieces

q: Fragmentation creates ______ effects at habitat boundaries.
Protected areas cover approximately ______ percent of land globally.
Match protected area type with management:
Protected areas are essential for biodiversity conservation.

o: Protected area for conservation and recreation

q: Rearrange protected area categories by strictness:

o: Strip of habitat connecting isolated areas

q: Corridors allow animals to ______ between habitat patches.
Wildlife crossings over roads are a form of corridor.

o: Protecting species in their natural habitat

q: In-situ is preferred over ex-situ conservation.

o: Protecting species outside their natural habitat

q: Ex-situ conservation includes zoos and seed ______.
The Svalbard Global Seed Vault is ex-situ conservation.
Captive breeding can save species from ______.
Match species with captive breeding success:

o: Releasing captive-bred animals to the wild

q: Soft release allows gradual adaptation to the wild.

o: Species whose protection benefits many others

q: Match conservation species type with purpose:
Giant pandas are both flagship and umbrella species.
Invasive species are second only to habitat loss in causing ______.

o: Illegal hunting or capturing of wildlife
Illegal trade in wildlife and products

q: Wildlife trafficking is a multi-______ dollar industry.
Match CITES appendix with protection level:
ESA protects species listed as endangered or ______.
The ESA has helped recover many species.
What is Convention on Biological Diversity?
CBD was adopted at the 1992 Earth ______.

o: Protecting 30% of land and sea by 2030

q: The 30 by 30 goal was adopted in ______.
30 by 30 is part of the Global Biodiversity Framework.
Restoration aims to return ecosystems to historical ______.
The UN Decade of Ecosystem Restoration is 2021-2030.

o: Large-scale restoration with minimal human management
Protected ocean zone for marine conservation

q: MPAs currently cover about ______ percent of oceans.

o: Area where all extraction is prohibited

q: No-take zones allow fish populations to ______.
No-take zones have spillover benefits for fishing areas.
Coral reefs support ______ percent of marine species.

o: Growing and transplanting corals to rebuild reefs

q: Coral restoration alone cannot solve climate impacts.

o: Protecting marsh, swamp, and bog ecosystems

q: Wetlands have lost over ______ percent of global area since 1700.
Ramsar sites are wetlands of international ______.
There are over 2,400 Ramsar sites globally.
Forests cover about ______ percent of land area.

o: UN program reducing emissions from deforestation

q: REDD+ provides financial incentives for forest ______.
REDD+ links forest conservation to climate action.

o: Managing forests for long-term ecological and economic benefits

q: Community conservancies support both wildlife and livelihoods.
Indigenous lands contain ______ percent of global biodiversity.
Free, prior, and informed consent is required for indigenous lands.

o: Area with high endemism facing severe habitat loss

q: Rearrange biodiversity hotspots by species richness:
Hotspots cover ______ percent of land but hold 50% of plant species.

o: Species found only in one location

q: Endemic species are especially vulnerable to extinction.

o: Modeling to assess species extinction risk
Smallest population with good survival chance

q: MVP is typically ______ or more breeding individuals.

o: Group of populations connected by dispersal
Introducing genes to increase genetic diversity

q: Genetic rescue addresses ______ in small populations.
Florida panther recovery used genetic rescue.

o: Genetic material shed by organisms into environment

q: eDNA can detect species from water ______.

o: Document outlining actions to recover endangered species

q: Post-release monitoring is essential for success.

o: Using motion-triggered cameras to photograph wildlife

q: Camera traps are non-______ monitoring tools.

o: Population estimation by marking and recapturing individuals

q: Photo-ID uses natural markings for individuals.
Match citizen science project with focus:

o: Responsible travel to natural areas supporting conservation

q: What is payment for ecosystem services?
o: Financial incentives for maintaining ecosystem benefits

q: PES rewards land managers for ecosystem ______.
Conservation finance includes grants, bonds, and ______.
The conservation finance gap is estimated at billions annually.
Debt swaps relieve country debt while funding ______.

o: Legal agreement limiting land use for conservation

q: Easements restrict development while keeping private ______.
Conservation easements are permanent in perpetuity.
What is climate adaptation for biodiversity?
o: Helping species and ecosystems cope with climate change

q: Climate adaptation helps species move to suitable ______.

o: Moving species to new areas as climate shifts

q: Assisted migration is controversial due to ______ risks.
Assisted migration is a last resort option.

o: Protecting nature in and around cities
Natural systems providing urban ecosystem services

q: Green infrastructure includes trees, wetlands, and green ______.

o: Protecting bees, butterflies, and other pollinators

q: Migratory species face threats across multiple ______.
CMS is the Convention on Migratory Species.

o: Protecting whales, dolphins, seals, and related species

q: Many marine mammals were hunted to near ______.

o: Protecting sharks from overfishing and finning

q: Sharks are apex predators essential for ocean ______.
All seven sea turtle species are threatened or ______.
Match sea turtle with nesting beach:
Beach protection helps sea turtle nesting success.
African elephant populations declined due to ______ trade.

o: Protecting rhinoceros from poaching and habitat loss

q: Rhino horn is valued in traditional medicine despite no ______.
The northern white rhino is functionally extinct.

o: Protecting gorillas, chimpanzees, bonobos, and orangutans

q: All great apes are endangered or ______.
Wild tiger numbers have increased to about ______.
TX2 aimed to double wild tigers by 2022.

o: Bringing extinct species back using technology

q: Conservation success gives hope for biodiversity.

o: Rapid decline in global species and ecosystems

q: One million species are at risk of ______.
The biodiversity crisis requires urgent global action.
EDGE scores combine evolutionary distinctiveness and endangerment.

o: Scientific approach to selecting and managing protected areas
Degree to which landscape facilitates species movement
Change in geographic distribution due to climate

q: Many species are shifting ______ or uphill.
Match species response with climate change:

o: Using nature to address societal challenges

q: NbS is increasingly recognized in climate policy.

o: Approach linking human, animal, and environmental health

q: Wildlife rehabilitation returns injured animals to wild.

o: Negative interactions between people and wildlife
Living alongside wildlife with minimal conflict

q: Modern zoos focus on conservation and ______.
Match botanic garden role with activity:
BGCI coordinates global botanical garden conservation.

o: Storing seeds for future conservation use

q: Seeds are stored at low temperature and ______.

o: Freezing biological material for long-term storage

q: Wildlife forensic labs support law enforcement.

o: Tracking wildlife trade to detect illegal activity
Reducing consumer demand for wildlife products
Using natural resources without depleting them

q: Sustainable use maintains resources for future ______.

o: Managing wildlife on private land for economic use

q: Game ranches provide habitat and economic ______.
Private conservation lands supplement protected areas.

o: Breeding wildlife in captivity for products

q: Wildlife farming may reduce or increase wild ______.

o: Disputes over conservation approaches and goals

q: Conflict resolution is essential for conservation success.
Match adaptive management step with action:
Adaptive management improves decision-making over time.

o: Using scientific evidence to guide decisions

q: What is protected area management effectiveness?
o: Assessing how well protected areas are managed

q: Many protected areas need improved management.

o: Strategic approach to achieving conservation goals

q: What is conservation theory of change?
o: Logic model linking actions to outcomes

q: Theory of change clarifies conservation logic.

o: Best practices for conservation project management

q: Mainstreaming is essential for halting biodiversity loss.

o: Stock of natural assets providing ecosystem services
Compensating for development impacts on biodiversity
Evaluating environmental effects of proposed projects

q: EIA is required for major development projects.

o: Environmental assessment of policies and plans
Difference between needed and available conservation funding

q: The conservation funding gap is estimated at ______ billion annually.
Closing the funding gap requires diverse sources.

o: Investment seeking conservation and financial returns
Measurable change resulting from conservation action

q: Conservation success is possible with sustained effort.
What is the future of conservation?
Conservation must evolve to meet growing challenges.

o: Detailed plan for conserving specific species

q: Species action plans guide conservation investment.

o: Prioritizing limited resources among many species

q: Triage accepts some species may be lost for ______.

o: Species used to represent others in conservation
Number of different species in an area

q: Species richness is one measure of biodiversity.

o: Range of functions performed by species in ecosystem
Future extinctions from past habitat loss

q: Extinction debt means species will disappear ______.
Extinction debt represents hidden biodiversity loss.
Edges can be harmful for interior ______.

o: Theory explaining species richness on islands
Proposal to protect half of Earth for biodiversity

q: Half-Earth would protect about ______ percent of land and sea.

o: UNESCO site for biodiversity and sustainable development
UNESCO site of outstanding universal value

q: World Heritage can be natural or ______.
World Heritage status brings international recognition.

o: Site identified as critical for bird conservation
Site contributing significantly to global persistence of biodiversity

q: What is Alliance for Zero Extinction?
o: Sites with endangered species found only there

q: AZE sites are critically important for preventing ______.
Connectivity allows gene flow and species ______.
Peace parks use conservation for diplomacy.

o: Managing whole ecosystems rather than single species
Managing whole landscapes for multiple objectives
Focusing on conservation successes and solutions

q: Conservation communication is essential for support.

o: Reasons people care about nature protection

q: Conservation protects life on Earth for future generations.

o: Systematic tracking of species populations over time

q: The Land Ethic was proposed by Aldo ______.

o: Predicting where species can live based on conditions
Predicting geographic range from environmental factors

q: SDMs help predict climate change impacts on ______.

o: Specific intervention to achieve conservation goal

q: Actions should be based on best available ______.
Conservation requires ongoing commitment and action.
Biodiversity is essential for human wellbeing.
Every species has inherent value worth protecting.
What is the goal of conservation biology?
Conservation biology emerged as a discipline in the ______.
We can make a difference for biodiversity.
